page.title: 17LOCAL NEWS IN CUMBERNAULD
page.content: The people of the area are kept informed of local news and events through the{Cumbernauld News. } The paper was first produced in{1961 } and now sells 12,500 copies per week. The news and information is gathered by a group of 8 people - an editor, 4 reporters, 2 photographers, and a receptionist. Information also comes from local people who visit the office or telephone. There are also events which they know about in advance, e.g, a planned council meeting, gala day etc. People buy the paper mainly{to keep {them informed of local issues} particularly if it involves them personally or their photograph is included. The number of papers sold increases if a{serious crime or {accident }has ocurred in the area as it is given more detailed coverage.
